page.title: 13A comparison of two farms
page.content: The dairy farm at Commonside has 5 local labourers, one the farmer's son. The average day is on of 12 hours starting with the milking at 6.30am. this takes until 8.30 then the rest of the time is spent on the arable crops. Rape seed covers 68 acres, 225 acres are wheat, 33 spring barley ,112 of winter barley and the rest grass. In the harvest season they can work anything up to a 20 hour day. The combine harvester cost Â£38,000 and also has tractors with various tools for different jobs. They do their own mechanical repairs and need to get 10 years out of them because of cost. The animals are bought/sold at Beeston Market with calves being sold at 3 weeks. Evening milking starts at about 4.00pm for a similar time as the morning session.
